content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 1 to node 0 is:

1 -> 3 -> 4 -> 5 -> 0

Remember that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path. Therefore, the shortest path from node 0 to node 1 is:

0 -> 5 -> 4 -> 3 -> 1

Please note that these are the shortest paths and they may contain more than one possible route.

The shortest path from node 0 to node 1 is:

0 -> 3 -> 4 -> 5

This is the shortest path that can be found in the graph. Note that this is the shortest path and it may contain more than one possible route.
